page.title: 02MAIN CHANGES SINCE 1930
page.content: IN 1930,THE POPULATION OF DIDCOT WAS ABOUT 400.WHAT IS NOW THE MILTON TRADING ESTATE WAS IN 1917 THE BIGGEST ARMY STORE IN EUROPE.THE MAIN BUILDING WAS THE CHEMIST CUM POST OFFICE.THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THAT ROAD WAS CALLED EAST HAGBOURNE.THE CINEMA WAS POPULAR SINCE THERE WAS NO TELEVISION.THE CENTRE OF EMPLOYMENT WAS THE RAILWAY.AT THE STATION THERE WERE ORIGINALLY 4 PLATFORMS BUT IN 1930-4 PLATFORM 5 WAS BUILT.THERE WERE 3 CLASSES ON THE TRAINS.THE RAILMEN WERE THE ONLY PEOPLE TRAINED IN FIRST AID AND THEY STARTED UP THE EMERGENCY SERVICES IN 1946.THERE ARE MANY OLD BUILDINGS HERE.THE OLDEST HOUSE,THE WHITE COTTGE, WAS BUILT IN 1854.THE PRESENT RECTORY COTTAGES WERE ONCE A SCHOOL.
